intro: Afrocayratia, commonly known as the African senna, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. It comprises several species native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. These plants are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their bipinnate leaves and showy yellow or orange flowers. Afrocayratia species often have pod fruits that contain several seeds, and they are adapted to grow in a variety of soil types. They play an important role in local ecosystems and are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
